text: LaGuardia Airport is still closed but in
a hotel ballroom just a few minutes away
officials are pressing ahead with
preparations of the iconic New York
Marathon on Wednesday time keepers were
laying out the scores of devices needed
to record the times of the more than
forty thousand runners who would in a
normal none hurricane year take to the
streets for the 43rd marathon despite
the travel problems the organizers New
York Roadrunners said they were still on
schedule or close to it if the race goes
ahead this coming sunday in november the
fourth these Gators are mats which
record the competitors as they pass each
mile and five kilometer point antenna
and certs in the square your cables
connect them the orange boxes are
controllers relaying those times to
marathon headquarters marathon officials
say the event last year brought a 342
350 million dollar boost to New York's
economy they expect to fall in numbers
this year but they say if it starts the
finish is taken care of this is steven
Farrell for the New York Times
